original: ma la sogs pa bcings par byed pas na de'i ngo bo yin no zhes rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: ma la sogs pa bcings par byed pas na de'i ngo bo yin no zhes rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The nature of that is due to binding mother and so on.

original: nyan thos pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyis de'i don ma rtogs pa de dgongs pa'o //🔽de bas na mtshon byed kyi sgra'i sgo nas gal te /
analyzed: nyan thos pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyis de'i don ma rtogs pa de dgongs pa'o // de bas na mtshon byed kyi sgra'i sgo nas gal te /
translated: The intention is that those of the śrāvaka type and so on do not understand its meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i don ston na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i don ston na /
translated: Therefore, if the Blessed One teaches the secret meaning through the door of indicative words,

original: de'i phyir khyed rnams ngan par gsungs pa'o zhes rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed rnams ngan par gsungs pa'o zhes rtogs pa yin no //
translated: then you should understand that he is speaking badly.

original: kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos nyid nyon cig /'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos nyid nyon cig /'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: O bodhisattvas, listen to the dharmatā of the tathāgatas, which is like this and so on.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni tshig phrad kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni tshig phrad kyi tshogs so //
translated: Here, like this is a collection of words.

original: dper na @133a * //
analyzed: dper na @133a * //
translated: For example,

original: zhes pas ni don bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes pas ni don bshad pa yin te /
translated: explains the meaning.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes pa ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes pa ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Son of noble family is a Tibetan word.

original: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po lnga pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po lnga pa ste /
translated: Space is the fifth great element.

original: thams cad ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i bdag nyid kyi khams gsum la rjes su song ba ni khyab cing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i bdag nyid kyi khams gsum la rjes su song ba ni khyab cing gnas pa'o //
translated: Everything is pervaded by and abides in the three realms, which have the nature of both the animate and inanimate.

original: chos thams cad kyang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang zhes pa ni /
translated: All phenomena are also

original: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i dngos po de rnams nam mkha'i khongs su gtogs pa ni nam mkha' de nyid la brten te gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i dngos po de rnams nam mkha'i khongs su gtogs pa ni nam mkha' de nyid la brten te gnas pa yin no //
translated: Those things that are material and those that are not material are included within space, and they exist in dependence on that space itself.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad nam mkha' dang lhan cig tu de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad nam mkha' dang lhan cig tu de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, all phenomena are connected with space by way of their essential identity.

original: chos de rnams dpyad pa yin na /
analyzed: chos de rnams dpyad pa yin na /
translated: When those phenomena are analyzed,

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas nyi shu'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas nyi shu'i bdag nyid de /
translated: the desire realm has the nature of twenty abodes.

original: de la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: One does not abide in that.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni rnam pa bcu bdun te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni rnam pa bcu bdun te /
translated: The form realm has seventeen divisions.

original: de la yang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: One does not abide in that.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The formless realm has four divisions.

original: de la yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: One does not abide in that.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de las so sor mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de las so sor mi dmigs so //
translated: Because all phenomena have the nature of space, they are not perceived separately from that.

original: gal te de rnams so sor dmigs par gyur pa yin na de'i tshe nam mkha' khyab par byed par ma gyur pa yin pa dang / med pa mi 'byung ba yang 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de rnams so sor dmigs par gyur pa yin na de'i tshe nam mkha' khyab par byed par ma gyur pa yin pa dang / med pa mi 'byung ba yang 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If they were perceived as separate, then space would not pervade them, and the non-arising of the non-existent would be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa la sogs pa bzhi po la yang so sor gnas par mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa la sogs pa bzhi po la yang so sor gnas par mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the four great elements are not perceived as existing separately in the four, earth, etc.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa kho nas so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa kho nas so //
translated: It is only through the connection of their identity.

original: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa yang de ltar rjes su rig par bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa yang de ltar rjes su rig par bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of noble family, all dharmas, including the aggregates, should be known in this way.

original: dpe bstan nas dpe las byung ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas dpe las byung ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having taught the example, the meaning of the example should be explained.

original: don gyi dbang 'di ni nam mkha' gnyis su med par mkhyen nas dpe nyid du blangs te /
analyzed: don gyi dbang 'di ni nam mkha' gnyis su med par mkhyen nas dpe nyid du blangs te /
translated: This meaning was understood as the non-duality of space, and it was taken as an example.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos sems can rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi bsam pa ni sna tshogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sems mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos sems can rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi bsam pa ni sna tshogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sems mkhyen nas /
translated: All the Tathagatas, having known the various dispositions of sentient beings, such as those of the Sravaka type, and their minds with their afflictions and secondary afflictions,

original: chos bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: chos bstan par mdzad de /
translated: teach the Dharma.

original: nad pa la nad dang rjes su mthun pa'i sman sman pas sbyin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nad pa la nad dang rjes su mthun pa'i sman sman pas sbyin pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a physician giving medicine to a patient in accordance with his illness.

original: de bas na rigs kyi bu rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de bas na rigs kyi bu rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig ni lnga ste /
translated: Therefore, O sons of good family, the commitment of the Tathagatas is fivefold,

original: gang zhig srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du bstan pa ste /
translated: which is taught as the path of unwholesome actions such as killing.

original: de rnams kyi nam mkha'i tshig @133b nges par brjod pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nam mkha'i tshig @133b nges par brjod pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The expression of their words should be understood as the nature of non-entity, the nature of luminosity.

original: dper na dam tshig lnga'i lam gyis bsgrub bya rnams dang / sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de dag 'od gsal ba la thim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na dam tshig lnga'i lam gyis bsgrub bya rnams dang / sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de dag 'od gsal ba la thim par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, those to be accomplished by the path of the five commitments, and whatever is accomplished, they dissolve into clear light.

original: gang zhig dam tshig ni bsgom pa'i ngo bo dang / gang zhig bsgrub bya ni bsgom pa dang / gang zhig sgrub byed ni bsgom pa po ste /
analyzed: gang zhig dam tshig ni bsgom pa'i ngo bo dang / gang zhig bsgrub bya ni bsgom pa dang / gang zhig sgrub byed ni bsgom pa po ste /
translated: Whatever is the essence of the meditation on the commitments, whatever is the meditation on the objects to be accomplished, and whatever is the meditation on the agent of accomplishment,

original: de dag thams cad 'od gsal ba de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'od gsal ba de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas par gyur te /
translated: all of them abide in the nature of that clear light.

original: dngos po med po'i theg pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi gsad bya dang / gsod par byed pa dang / 'phrog bya dang / 'phrog byed dang / 'dod bya dang 'dod par byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po med po'i theg pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi gsad bya dang / gsod par byed pa dang / 'phrog bya dang / 'phrog byed dang / 'dod bya dang 'dod par byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those who have entered the vehicle of non-entity do not observe the objects to be killed, the killers, the objects to be robbed, the robbers, the objects of desire, and the agents of desire, and so on.

original: sgyu ma'i rnam pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad mthong bas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rnam pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad mthong bas so //
translated: Because all entities are seen to be like illusions.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las kyang /🔽ji ltar sprul pas sprul pa yi //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma las kyang / ji ltar sprul pas sprul pa yi //
translated: And in the Bhagavatī,🔽Just as an emanation sees

original: grong khyer mthong bar gyur pa ste //
analyzed: grong khyer mthong bar gyur pa ste //
translated: an emanated city,

original: las kyi sprul pa'i 'gro ba yis //
analyzed: las kyi sprul pa'i 'gro ba yis //
translated: The beings of the emanation karma

original: gzugs rnams de ltar mthong ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs rnams de ltar mthong ba yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: see forms in that way.

original: gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang /
translated: And also from another source:🔽If even the knowledge of Rudra,

original: drag po nyer 'gro rig pa ni //
analyzed: drag po nyer 'gro rig pa ni //
translated: who moves in the vicinity,

original: skad cig nyid la'ang mi 'dod na //🔽gsad bya med cing gsod byed med //
analyzed: skad cig nyid la'ang mi 'dod na // gsad bya med cing gsod byed med //
translated: does not desire it in an instant,🔽what need to mention

original: tshul 'di la ni smos ci dgos //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: tshul 'di la ni smos ci dgos // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo ;
translated: this method, which is without a victim and without a killer.

original: / de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa bstan nas /
analyzed: / de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the connection of identity,

original: de las byung ba'i 'brel pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'brel pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that all phenomena are essenceless by means of the connection of origination,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gtsub stan ni 'og ma'i shing ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gtsub stan ni 'og ma'i shing ngo //
translated: he says, “Thus, etc.”🔽The friction board is the lower piece of wood.

analyzed: gtsub shing ni steng gi shing ngo //

analyzed: me 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dper na me de nyid gtsub stan la mi gnas pa ni gtsub shing med pa na de las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro//

analyzed: gtsub shing la yang mi gnas pa ni gtsub stan med na de med pa'i phyir ro // de nyid med na mi'i lag pa bskyod pas bskyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does it exist in the kindling, because it does not exist when the fire stick does not exist.🔽Nor does it arise from the movement of the man’s hand when those two do not exist.

original: de la yang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Nor does it exist in the movement of the man’s hand.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa la brten nas me skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa la brten nas me skyed par 'gyur te /

original: gcig ni gang yang rung bskyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni gang yang rung bskyed par byed pa ma yin te /

original: @134a * // tshogs pa ni skyed byed yin no //
analyzed: @134a * // tshogs pa ni skyed byed yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig 'di tshogs pas skyed pa de ni 'byung ba ma yin te phan tshun du ltos pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: de ni byung ba ji ltar yin //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //

original: dpe las ma byung ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dpe las ma byung ba bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu zhes pa ni bde pa'i tshig go //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ni lnga ste /

original: de rnams de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams de bzhin du shes par bya'o //

original: dper na bsgrub bya dang / sgrub byed dang ; sgrub pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya bar gyur pa gang yin pa thams cad de ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na bsgrub bya dang / sgrub byed dang ; sgrub pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya bar gyur pa gang yin pa thams cad de ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin te /

analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa bzhin no //

analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'od ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya ste /

analyzed: 'gro ba ni chos thams cad 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa dang / 'od ba ni de nyid las byung ba'o //

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang /

original: ji ltar dangs pa'i chu dag las //
analyzed: ji ltar dangs pa'i chu dag las //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //

translated: The yogi/nī who has analyzed in this way will not understand the liberation of bondage, merit and sin, the classification of the Tathāgata and ordinary beings,

analyzed: sprul pa bzhin du des ni chos thams cad snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like an emanation, he/she sees all phenomena.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: smig rgyu rmi lam sgyu ma chu zla 'dra ba'i srid pa gsum //

analyzed: tha mar 'gag phyir yod min byung phyir gzhan min gnyis ka min //

analyzed: 'on kyang glo bur ba'i dri ma sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir rtsol ba dang bla ma dang slob ma'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu bstan to //

analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i bstod pa las kyang /

original: ji ltar 'o ma dangs pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'o ma dangs pa yis //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de bas na rigs kyi bu rnams sngags kyi spyod pa de bzhin du shes par gyis shig ces tshig gi lhag ma'o//

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'das ma thag tu de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag ces pa sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni de las byung ba'i 'brel pa'i dpe nye bar mtshon pa'i dngos po med pas so //

analyzed: de'i don thos nas ngoms shing tshim pa ste /

analyzed: de rnams don dam par dpyad na /

translated: The Blessed One Vajradhara, in order to perform the welfare of the world in such things, and in order to purify the adventitious defilements, teaches the arising of the complete form of the deity, the various forms of the commitments and mantras,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so //

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das de nyid ni don dam pa bshad du gsol /

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sngags ni a'a li dang k'a li'i ngo bo yi ge phyi mo de nyid kyi snying po ni a'a la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: sngags ni a'a li dang k'a li'i ngo bo yi ge phyi mo de nyid kyi snying po ni a'a la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: The mantra is the essence of the reality of the vowels and consonants, the seed of which is the eight, a, etc.

original: de rnams bsdus pa ni aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha ste /
analyzed: de rnams bsdus pa ni aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha ste /
translated: The collection of those is a, ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, and śa.

original: de rnams kyang bsdus pa ni bud med la sogs pa'i dbye bas yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyang bsdus pa ni bud med la sogs pa'i dbye bas yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The collection of those is the three syllables, by way of the division into female, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sku gsung thugs ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sku gsung thugs ni /
translated: Therefore, the body, speech, and mind

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gsum ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gsum ste ;
translated: are the three transcendent lords,

original: de rnams kyis gsang bar bsgrags pa ni gsang ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis gsang bar bsgrags pa ni gsang ba'i snying po'o //
translated: and the proclamation of the secret by them is the secret essence.

original: de bzhin du dngos grub chen po ni rdo rje 'chang gi dngos grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos grub chen po ni rdo rje 'chang gi dngos grub ste /
translated: Similarly, the great power is the power of Vajradhara,

original: de nyid kyi tshul gyi mchog ni phul du byung ba'i lam yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshul gyi mchog ni phul du byung ba'i lam yin no zhes ston to //
translated: and the supreme method of that is the path of excellence.

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the creation stage.🔽In order to explain that it was spoken by Great Vajradhara immediately after the request of the transcendent lords,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab ma thag tu rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa'o zhes sdud pa pos bshad par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab ma thag tu rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa'o zhes sdud pa pos bshad par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: the compiler says,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: rdo rje ni yi ge gsum 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'dzin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //🔽rdo rje ni sngags kyis bskul bas nus pa 'gugs pa 'dzin pa mdzad pa ste rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: rdo rje ni yi ge gsum 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'dzin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o // rdo rje ni sngags kyis bskul bas nus pa 'gugs pa 'dzin pa mdzad pa ste rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Vajradhara is the stage of generation, because he holds the three syllables.

original: de ni las rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: de ni las rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: Vajradhara is the supreme victor of action, because he holds the invocation of the power of the mantra.

original: rdo rje ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sku ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sku ste /
translated: Vajra is the body of the nature of the three sattvas.

original: de nyid 'dzin pa ni skyed par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'dzin pa ni skyed par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Vajradhara is the creator of that, because he holds it.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal bya mchog go //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal bya mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme victor of the mandala.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nus pa 'gugs pas ni rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nus pa 'gugs pas ni rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is the victor, because he invokes the power of all the tathagatas.

original: nyon mongs kun ni de'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs kun ni de'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: All the afflictions are the tathagatas, who are the essence of their purification.

original: de nyid rigs brgya'i dbye ba mang ba'i phyir rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: de nyid rigs brgya'i dbye ba mang ba'i phyir rgya mtsho ste /
translated: That is the ocean, because it is the multiplicity of the divisions of the hundred families.

original: de rnams kyi gtso bo ni spro ba dang bsdu ba las dbang dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtso bo ni spro ba dang bsdu ba las dbang dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The lord of those is the one who is powerful over the emanation and gathering of those.

original: 'bar ba ni 'bar ba'i ngo bo lha mo rnams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni 'bar ba'i ngo bo lha mo rnams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Blazing” is because of the generation of the goddesses, who are the nature of blazing.

original: drag po ni khro bo rnams te /
analyzed: drag po ni khro bo rnams te /
translated: “Fierce” is the wrathful ones,

original: de bskyed pa'i phyir drag po'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i phyir drag po'o //
translated: and because of their generation, they are “fierce.”

original: spyan ni yangs pa lnga po gang la yod pa de ni spyan yangs pa'o //
analyzed: spyan ni yangs pa lnga po gang la yod pa de ni spyan yangs pa'o //
translated: “Expansive eyes” are those that are wide open.

original: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal te /
translated: The Bhagavān, who is like that, said this:

original: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams dang // zhes bya ba la @136a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid rnams dang // zhes bya ba la @136a * //
translated: “The body, speech, and mind, etc.,”

original: sogs pa / lus la sogs pa gsum po gang yang yin pa de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: sogs pa / lus la sogs pa gsum po gang yang yin pa de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: whatever is one of the three, body, etc., is a vajra because it is the nature of the tathāgatas.

original: de nyid sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: That very [vajra] should be contemplated as the tathāgata, who is the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: gzhan yang lha'i rnam pa brtan par gyur na /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa ni spros pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha'i rnam pa brtan par gyur na / rnam par mi rtog pa ni spros pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: Moreover, if the form of the deity becomes stable,🔽“nonconceptuality” is a mind free from conceptual elaboration.

original: mi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa dang bral ba'i ngag go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa dang bral ba'i ngag go //
translated: “Nonapprehending” is speech free from apprehension.

original: khams gsum pa mnyam pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni lus so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa mnyam pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni lus so //
translated: The nature of equality is the body, because the three realms are equal.

original: de rnams de lta bur sgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams de lta bur sgom par bya ste /
translated: They should be cultivated in that way.

original: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: The creation stage and the perfection stage.

original: yang na lus la sogs pa ni tha mal pa'i phyir rdo rje ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lus la sogs pa ni tha mal pa'i phyir rdo rje ste bstan pa'o //
translated: Or else, the body, etc., are the vajra, because they are ordinary, and they are taught.

original: de rnams sku la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid kyis bsgom pa ni bsam bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams sku la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid kyis bsgom pa ni bsam bya'o //
translated: Their cultivation by means of the emptiness of the body, etc., is to be contemplated.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Non-conceptuality is emptiness.

original: mi dmigs pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is signlessness.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni smon pa med pa'o /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni smon pa med pa'o /
translated: Equality is wishlessness.

original: de ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis /
translated: Thus, by means of the three gates of liberation,

original: lus la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba ni gang du yang mi gnas zhes sgom mo //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba ni gang du yang mi gnas zhes sgom mo //
translated: the cultivation of the body, etc., is to be contemplated as not abiding anywhere.

original: de ni dang po sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dang po sbyor ba'o //
translated: That is the first application.

original: yang na lus la sogs pa ni dang po ting nge 'dzin gyis stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na lus la sogs pa ni dang po ting nge 'dzin gyis stong pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: Or else, the body, etc., are the vajra, because they become empty by means of the first concentration, and they are indivisible.

original: de rnams sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo zhal gsum dang phyag drug gi rnam pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' dang lhan cig tu dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo zhal gsum dang phyag drug gi rnam pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' dang lhan cig tu dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on those as inseparable with Vajrasattva, who has the nature of body, speech, and mind, and the form of three faces and six arms.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang mi dmigs pa ni lha mo rnams dang ; mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni phyogs bcu la mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas pa'i khro bo rnams dang lhan cig tu bsgoms la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang mi dmigs pa ni lha mo rnams dang ; mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo ni phyogs bcu la mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas pa'i khro bo rnams dang lhan cig tu bsgoms la /
translated: Nonconceptuality is the tathāgatas, nonapprehension is the goddesses, and the nature of sameness is the wrathful ones abiding in the ten directions.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i ngo bo chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gzhir gyur pa'i gzhal yas khang pa la zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i gdan la zhugs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i ngo bo chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gzhir gyur pa'i gzhal yas khang pa la zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i gdan la zhugs pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on the maṇḍala that is not located anywhere, the nature of which is without beginning or end, and which is situated on a seat of the moon, sun, and so on, in the celestial mansion that is the basis of the seal of the source of phenomena.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: The maṇḍala is the supreme victor.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rdo rje ni bdag dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams sku gsung thugs bsgom pa ni sku la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la de'i rjes la @136b rnam par mi rtog pa ni gsum mi dmigs pa'i bsam pas bstod la /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rdo rje ni bdag dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams sku gsung thugs bsgom pa ni sku la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs la de'i rjes la @136b rnam par mi rtog pa ni gsum mi dmigs pa'i bsam pas bstod la /
translated: Then, nonconceptuality is the praise with the thought of the nonapprehension of the three.

original: mi dmigs pa ni mchod bya dang mchod byed dang mchod pa dang bral ba'i bsam pas mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mchod bya dang mchod byed dang mchod pa dang bral ba'i bsam pas mchod pa byas la /
translated: Nonapprehension is the offering with the thought free from the object of offering, the offerer, and the offering.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsi lnga ro gcig par byas la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsi lnga ro gcig par byas la /
translated: Equality is the five nectars made of one taste by the process of purification and so forth.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bor myang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bor myang bar bya ste /
translated: Nonabiding is the tasting of that as the essence of Great Vajradhara himself.

original: las rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: las rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: This is the supreme victory activity.

original: de bzhin du lus la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum ste /
translated: Likewise, body and so forth are the three syllables.

original: de nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
translated: They are vajra because they are the nature of Vairochana and so forth.

original: de rnams sku gsung thugs ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i rim pas bsgoms la /
analyzed: de rnams sku gsung thugs ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i rim pas bsgoms la /
translated: One should meditate on those as body, speech, and mind, by way of the process of entering, abiding, and rising.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang / mi dmigs pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid ni me long lta bu'i ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang / mi dmigs pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid ni me long lta bu'i ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Non-conceptuality is the meditation on the wisdom of the sphere of reality, non-apprehension is the meditation on the wisdom of discernment, and equality is the meditation on the mirror-like wisdom.

original: de nas ye shes kyi rnam par rtog pa yang spangs la 'jug pa la sogs pa la nye bar bsdus te /
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi rnam par rtog pa yang spangs la 'jug pa la sogs pa la nye bar bsdus te /
translated: Then, one should also abandon the conceptualization of wisdom, and gather it into entering and so forth.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni ma ning gi bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni ma ning gi bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Not abiding anywhere is the recitation of the neutral state.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Analysis of Karma it is said:

original: don rtogs pa yi bzlas pa yis //
analyzed: don rtogs pa yi bzlas pa yis //
translated: “The recitation of the realization of the meaning🔽. . .

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ” and so forth.

original: rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the process of the vajra recitation.

original: yang na lus la sogs pa rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na lus la sogs pa rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, because the body and so forth are the cause,

original: lus ngag yid ni rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lus ngag yid ni rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
translated: the body, speech, and mind are the three consciousnesses.

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
translated: They are vajra because they are endowed with the afflictions.

original: de rnams sku la sogs pa nya bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba bsgom pa ni zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams sku la sogs pa nya bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba bsgom pa ni zhugs par bya'o //
translated: One should enter the clear light, which is the nature of the withdrawal of those bodies, etc.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni snang ba'i ye shes dang / mi dmigs pa ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni snang ba'i ye shes dang / mi dmigs pa ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The non-conceptual is the pristine wisdom of appearance, the non-apprehension is the pristine wisdom of the increase of appearance, and the sameness is the pristine wisdom of the attainment of appearance.

original: ye shes gsum po de dag gi rim pas rnam par shes pa de rnams 'od gsal ba la bzhugs shing gang na yang mi gnas pa ni 'od gsal ba de nyid kyi ngo bor bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes gsum po de dag gi rim pas rnam par shes pa de rnams 'od gsal ba la bzhugs shing gang na yang mi gnas pa ni 'od gsal ba de nyid kyi ngo bor bsgom par bya ste /
translated: By the sequence of those three pristine wisdoms, one should meditate on the withdrawal of those consciousnesses into the clear light, which is not located anywhere, as the entity of just that clear light.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sku la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rdo rje ste sku la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du bsgom pa ni spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o // de bzhin du sku la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rdo rje ste sku la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du bsgom pa ni spro bar bya'o //
translated: This is the stage of the purification of mind.🔽Similarly, one should emanate the bodies, etc., which are the nature of the vajra, because they are like an illusion, simultaneously from the clear light, which is the nature of the withdrawal of the bodies, etc.

original: rnam par @137a * //
analyzed: rnam par @137a * //
translated: The sequence of the emanation of the bodies, etc.

original: mi rtog pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang mi dmigs pa ni me long gi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba dang / mnyam pa nyid ni chu zla dang 'dra ba dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi sku ste /
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang mi dmigs pa ni me long gi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba dang / mnyam pa nyid ni chu zla dang 'dra ba dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi sku ste /
translated: Non-conceptuality is like an illusion, non-apprehension is like a reflection in a mirror, equality is like the moon in water, and non-abiding anywhere is the body of gnosis that transcends existence and nonexistence.

original: de nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: That is what should be cultivated.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of self-consecration.

original: yang na lus la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: yang na lus la sogs pa ni /
translated: Or else, the body and so forth

original: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: are of the nature of passion, dispassion, and neutrality.

original: de nyid 'khor ba pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'khor ba pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: That itself is the vajra because it is indivisible by those in cyclic existence.

original: de rnams sku gsung thugs ro gcig par gyur pa'i bzhi pa dang lhan cig tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams sku gsung thugs ro gcig par gyur pa'i bzhi pa dang lhan cig tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those should be cultivated together with the fourth, which has become of one taste as the body, speech, and mind of a buddha.

original: gal te de ltar byas na yang de kho na nyid brtan par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byas na yang de kho na nyid brtan par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If even though one does that, reality does not become stable,

original: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa ni ril por 'dzin pa dang / mi dmigs pa ni rjes su gzhig pas bsgom zhing mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags bral ba dang bsre bar gyur pa gang du yang mi gnas pa ni de kho na nyid rnal 'byor pas snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa ni ril por 'dzin pa dang / mi dmigs pa ni rjes su gzhig pas bsgom zhing mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags bral ba dang bsre bar gyur pa gang du yang mi gnas pa ni de kho na nyid rnal 'byor pas snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, non-conceptuality is meditation on the whole, and non-apprehension is meditation on the parts. The nature of equality is the mixing of attachment and non-attachment, and the non-abiding in any state whatsoever is the reality that will appear to the yogi.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mnyam pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mnyam pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: Likewise, body, speech, and mind are vajras because they are equal to Great Vajradhara.

original: lus ngag yid ni khams gsum pa dang lhan cig tu byas nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid ni khams gsum pa dang lhan cig tu byas nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having made body, speech, and mind together with the three realms, one should meditate.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / mi dmigs pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa dang / de dag mnyam pa nyid ni dbyer med par byed par de'i ngo bo dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas par rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgom par bya ste zung 'jug gi rim pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / mi dmigs pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa dang / de dag mnyam pa nyid ni dbyer med par byed par de'i ngo bo dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas par rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgom par bya ste zung 'jug gi rim pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptuality is the conventional truth, non-apprehension is the ultimate truth, and their sameness is the indivisibility of those two, which is the essence of that.  Not dwelling anywhere is not dwelling in cyclic existence or nirvana, and one should meditate on the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i shes rab ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i shes rab ma'o //
translated: Similarly, the vajra of body, speech, and mind is the wisdom consort who possesses the dharma-source seal.

original: lus la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i rdo rjes nye bar mtshon pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni aa lingga na'o //🔽yid mi bde ba'i dmigs pa la gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i rdo rjes nye bar mtshon pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o // rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni aa lingga na'o // yid mi bde ba'i dmigs pa la gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The yoga of the practitioner who is characterized by the vajra that generates the body, etc. is the correct union.🔽Non-conceptuality is the vajra of the a-stroke because it destroys conceptuality.

original: mi dmigs pa ni tsumba na'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni tsumba na'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is the vajra of the u-stroke because it is the antidote to the object of mental dissatisfaction.

original: rtsa rnams ro gcig par byed pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid @137b bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams ro gcig par byed pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid @137b bskyod pa'o //
translated: Since the channels are made of one taste, it is the movement of uniformity.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: Since it does not abide anywhere, it is like a rainbow.

original: de rnams bya ba ste rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams bya ba ste rang bzhin no //
translated: Those are the activities.

original: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: Similarly, the vajra of body, speech, and mind is the dharma-source mudra.

original: lus ngag yid ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: lus ngag yid ni rdo rje ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the vajra.

original: de nyid kyi bsgom pa ni de dang yang dag par sbyor zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bsgom pa ni de dang yang dag par sbyor zhing /
translated: The meditation on that is the union with that.

original: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa ni rtsa zla ba ma dang / mi dmigs pa ni rus sbal ma ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa ni rtsa zla ba ma dang / mi dmigs pa ni rus sbal ma ste /
translated: At that time, nonconceptuality is the moon channel, and nonapprehending is the tortoise channel.

original: de dag mnyam por byas la /
analyzed: de dag mnyam por byas la /
translated: Those two are made equal.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni 'dod pa'i gdugs ma ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni 'dod pa'i gdugs ma ste /
translated: Uniformity is the desire parasol channel.

original: de rnams rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor bas /
analyzed: de rnams rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor bas /
translated: Since those are the union of the vajra and lotus,

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni dmigs pa med par skyed par 'gyur te rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni dmigs pa med par skyed par 'gyur te rgyu'o //
translated: it is generated without reference point, which is the cause.

original: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs ni khams rnams kyi gnas yin pas sku gsung thugs ni padma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs ni khams rnams kyi gnas yin pas sku gsung thugs ni padma'o //
translated: Likewise, the body, speech, and mind are the abode of the elements, so the body, speech, and mind are the lotus.

original: rdo rje ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is the secret vajra.

original: de dag lus ngag yid ni h'um dang phat la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab par byas la /
analyzed: de dag lus ngag yid ni h'um dang phat la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlab par byas la /
translated: Those are consecrated with the seed syllables of body, speech, and mind, hūṃ and phaṭ, and so on.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni padma bskyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa ni rdo rje bskyod pa dang / mnyam pa nyid ni gnyi ga bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni padma bskyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa ni rdo rje bskyod pa dang / mnyam pa nyid ni gnyi ga bskyod pa ste /
translated: Nonconceptuality is the shaking of the lotus, nonapprehension is the shaking of the vajra, and equality is the shaking of both.

original: de rnams byas la gang du yang mi gnas pa'i bde ba chen po thob par gyur te las so //🔽de bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni byang chub sems kyi thig le ste /
analyzed: de rnams byas la gang du yang mi gnas pa'i bde ba chen po thob par gyur te las so // de bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni byang chub sems kyi thig le ste /
translated: Having done those, one should attain the great bliss that does not abide anywhere.🔽Likewise, the vajra of body, speech, and mind is the drop of bodhicitta.

original: de nyid lus ngag yid ni rdo rje'i rtse mor bsgom pa ni 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid lus ngag yid ni rdo rje'i rtse mor bsgom pa ni 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: That itself is the body, speech, and mind, which is meditated upon, that is, held, at the tip of the vajra.

original: rnam par mi rtog ni dga' ba zad pas mi dmigs pa ni mchog tu dga' ba med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid ni dga' bral dang mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ni dga' ba zad pas mi dmigs pa ni mchog tu dga' ba med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid ni dga' bral dang mi dmigs pas /
translated: Non-conceptuality is the exhaustion of joy, non-apprehension is the absence of supreme joy, and sameness is the absence of joy and absence of apprehension.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni bde ba chen po'i rang rig par bsgom par bya ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni bde ba chen po'i rang rig par bsgom par bya ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: Non-abiding anywhere is the cultivation of the intrinsic awareness of great bliss, which is the result.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni dbang po rnams te /
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind are the sense faculties.

original: de dag lus ngag yid ni yul rnams dang gcig tu byas la /
analyzed: de dag lus ngag yid ni yul rnams dang gcig tu byas la /
translated: Those are the body, speech, and mind that are made one with the objects.

original: bsgom pa ni 'dod pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni 'dod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: Cultivation is the enjoyment of desire.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni dman pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba dang / mi dmigs pa ni bar pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba dang / mnyam pa nyid ni mchog gi 'du shes dang bral zhing gang na yang mi gnas pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bos yul de rnams spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni dman pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba dang / mi dmigs pa ni bar pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba dang / mnyam pa nyid ni mchog gi 'du shes dang bral zhing gang na yang mi gnas pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bos yul de rnams spyad par bya ste /
translated: Non-conceptuality is the absence of inferior discrimination, non-apprehension is the absence of middling discrimination, sameness is the absence of supreme discrimination, and non-abiding anywhere is the enjoyment of those objects with the essence of Great Vajradhara.

original: so sor sdud pa'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa'o //
translated: That is the practice of withdrawal.

original: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni yul dang dbang po rnams te /🔽de @138a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni yul dang dbang po rnams te / de @138a * //
translated: Likewise, the vajra of body, speech, and mind are the objects and the sense faculties.

original: dag lus ngag yid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig tu byas la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dag lus ngag yid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig tu byas la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those are the body, speech, and mind, which should be cultivated in union with the Tathāgatas.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid gong nas rim pas yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid gong nas rim pas yongs su spangs te /
translated: Nonconceptuality, nonapprehending, sameness, and not dwelling anywhere are, in order, the complete abandonment of investigation, analysis, joy, bliss, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan la gnas par bya ste bstan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas par bya ste bstan no //
translated: One should abide in concentration, as taught.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni thig le ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni thig le ste /
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is the drop.

original: de nyid lus ngag yid ni rnam pa gsum gyi sna'i rtse mor bsgom par bya ba ni 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid lus ngag yid ni rnam pa gsum gyi sna'i rtse mor bsgom par bya ba ni 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: That itself is the body, speech, and mind, which should be cultivated at the tip of the nose, that is, should be apprehended.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i 'bru'i tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i 'bru'i tshad tsam mo //
translated: Nonconceptuality is the size of a mustard seed.

original: mi dmigs pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Non-apprehension is the nature of the ultimate.

original: mnyam pa nyid du steng du rgyu ba dang yang nye bar bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du steng du rgyu ba dang yang nye bar bsdu ba ste /
translated: The movement of the breath is to be gathered into the state of equality.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra bar rgyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra bar rgyur ba'o //
translated: It moves like a waterwheel, day and night.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni /
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni /
translated: It does not abide anywhere.

original: kun du 'gro ba chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya ste /
translated: It is to be seen as the nature of the all-pervading expanse of reality.

original: srog dang rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba'o //
translated: This is the life-force and exertion.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni thig le tsam de nyid de /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni thig le tsam de nyid de /
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is that very drop.

original: lus ngag yid ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: lus ngag yid ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dang bral ba /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are free from the activities of engagement and so forth.

original: bsgom pa ni 'dzin par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni 'dzin par bya ste /
translated: Meditation is to be held.

original: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'jug pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba dang / mi dmigs pa ni gnas pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba dang / mnyam pa nyid ni ldang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba bsgom par bya ste 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'jug pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba dang / mi dmigs pa ni gnas pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba dang / mnyam pa nyid ni ldang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang / gang na yang mi gnas pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba bsgom par bya ste 'dzin pa'o //
translated: At that time, non-conceptuality is free from the conceptualization of engagement, non-apprehension is free from the conceptualization of abiding, sameness is free from the conceptualization of rising, and not abiding anywhere is the meditation on the unchanging nature of Mahāvajradhara, which is the grasping.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku ste /
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is the body of Mahāvajradhara.

original: lus ngag yid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku dang lhan cig tu byas la /
analyzed: lus ngag yid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku dang lhan cig tu byas la /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are made into the body of the tathāgatas.

original: bsgom pa ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni bsam pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the intention.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni sa thim pas na smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni sa thim pas na smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: Non-conceptuality is like a mirage because the earth element dissolves.

original: mi dmigs pa ni chu thim pas na du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni chu thim pas na du ba lta bu'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is like smoke because the water element dissolves.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni me thim pas na srin bu me khyer lta bu'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni me thim pas na srin bu me khyer lta bu'o //
translated: Sameness is like a firefly because the fire element dissolves.

original: gang du ni rlung thim pas na mar me lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang du ni rlung thim pas na mar me lta bu'o //
translated: Where is like a lamp because the wind element dissolves.

original: mi gnas pa ni khams bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni khams bzhi'o //
translated: The non-abiding is the four elements.

original: rnam par rtog pa thim pas na sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thim pas na sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: The dissolution of conceptualization is like the cloudless sky.

original: de lta bu'i sku mthong bas shin tu gsal ba rjes @138b su dran pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku mthong bas shin tu gsal ba rjes @138b su dran pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: By seeing such a body, the recollection of the very clear arises.

original: rje sus dran pa'o //
analyzed: rje sus dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection is of the body.

original: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: Likewise, the body, speech, and mind are conventional.

original: yang lus ngag yid ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: yang lus ngag yid ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the body, speech, and mind are ultimate.

original: bsgom pa de ni de dag gnyis su med par bsgom pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa de ni de dag gnyis su med par bsgom pa lta bu'o //
translated: That meditation is like the meditation on the non-duality of those two.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-conceptuality is free from the conceptualization of clean and unclean, and so forth.

original: mi dmigs pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtag pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtag pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is free from the conceptualization of having aspects and not having aspects.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni dgra dang zin la sogs pa la rang bzhin mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni dgra dang zin la sogs pa la rang bzhin mnyam pa'o //
translated: Equality is the equality of nature in friend and enemy, and so forth.

original: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni zung 'jug gi bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya ste ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas pa ni zung 'jug gi bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya ste ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: One should cultivate the samādhi of the nature of union, which does not abide anywhere.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Thus, there is yoga.

original: sku gsung thugs gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi rigs kyi sdom pa ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi rigs kyi sdom pa ste /
translated: The three of body, speech, and mind are the vows of the families of body, speech, and mind.

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / phyi la sogs pa dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang rdo rje la sogs pa dang / kha zas la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / mchod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / phyi la sogs pa dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang rdo rje la sogs pa dang / kha zas la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / mchod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One should go for refuge to the Three Jewels, listen to the holy Dharma, such as the outer and so on, give food, and so on, and make offerings, and so on.

original: lus ngag yid las byung ba'i bdud rtsi ni lus ngag yid do //
analyzed: lus ngag yid las byung ba'i bdud rtsi ni lus ngag yid do //
translated: The nectar that arises from body, speech, and mind is body, speech, and mind.

original: de nyid bsgom pa ni bdud rtsi myang ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bsgom pa ni bdud rtsi myang ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Cultivating that is cultivating the tasting of nectar.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid rnams ni sha gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid rnams ni sha gsum mo //
translated: The three meats are nonconceptuality, nonapprehending, and equality.

original: gang yang zhes pa ni rta'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes pa ni rta'o //
translated: “ Whatever” is a horse.

original: mi gnas pa ni mi'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni mi'o //
translated: “ Nonabiding” is a human.

original: lcags kyu 'di rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'dus byas te bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu 'di rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'dus byas te bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat these hooks, having gathered them with the stages of mantra and mudra.

original: de ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: That is the accomplishment.

original: de ltar snying po bskul ba'i dang po bcom ldan 'das kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar snying po bskul ba'i dang po bcom ldan 'das kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan te /
translated: Thus, having first taught the Bhagavān’s samādhi, the invocation of the essence,

original: snying po bskul ba la rjes su mthun pa ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snying po bskul ba la rjes su mthun pa ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the attainment of the concordant samādhi in the invocation of the essence,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “thereupon,” and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The naturally pure one is Mahāvajradhara.

original: thams cad la pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of going to the other side of everything,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: the perfection is all the tathāgatas.

original: sngags ni snying po'i sngags rnams so //
analyzed: sngags ni snying po'i sngags rnams so //
translated: The mantra is the essence mantras.

original: tshul ni zhags pa dang lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sbyor bas de rnams dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul ni zhags pa dang lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sbyor bas de rnams dgug par bya'o //
translated: The method is to summon them by the application of the noose, hook, and so on.

original: de nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
translated: That is the vajra because of being just that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Having entered into the samādhi called that,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa @139a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa @139a * //
translated: all the tathāgatas, Akṣhobhya, and so on,

original: la 'di skad bka' stsal te /
analyzed: la 'di skad bka' stsal te /
translated: spoke thus:🔽“Thus have I heard.”

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The creation stage.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Blessed One, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mi bskyod pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni bod pa'i don du byed tshig dang po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mi bskyod pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni bod pa'i don du byed tshig dang po'o //
translated: All the Tathāgatas, Akṣobhya, etc. is the first case for the sake of the Tibetan meaning.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni rtags kyi don tsam la byed tshig dang po'o //
